Description: Granodiorite block-statue of Kamose: the figure wears a skirt terminating at the knees. On the left thigh is a writing palette with two inkwells, from which a cord hangs down. The inscriptions are incised on a papyrus roll resting on the lap of the figure, and on the upper surface, front, sides and back, of its pedestal. The feet and the fron t part of the pedestal are severely mutilated, but the inscriptions throughout are undamaged.
Curator's comments: Text includes: title of Kamose ‘Standard-bearer of the company ‘Nebmaatre is the Shining Sun-disc’’. Son of May and Takhat. Text also mentions Min of Koptos and Isis, and includes a cartouche of Amenhotep III. Bibliography: B. Porter & R. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs and Paintings' VIII (Oxford: Clarendon Press), p. 613; R. Schulz, ‘Die Entwicklung und Bedeutung des kuboiden Statuentypus’ 2 Vols. ‘Hildesheimer Ägyptologische Beiträge’ 34 (1992), [99] and Volume 33 p.381-382. I. Regulski (ed.), 2022. Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt, pp. 170-1
Bibliographic references: Edwards 1939 / Hieroglyphic Texts from Egyptian Stelae e.t.c. in the British Museum (pl.13)
Exhibition history: 2022-2023 13 Oct-19 Feb, London, BM, Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
